noun.description: The offering of particular prices for something, especially at an auction.
examples: other companies in the bidding include General Electric
their first sale produced a wide range of lots and some energetic bidding

noun.description: The ordering or requesting of someone to do something.
examples: the clandestine associations that would act at their bidding
I never needed a second bidding

phrases: Either way, we nod politely and do their bidding as we once did for czars and sultans.
His team grumbled and did his bidding for a few days.
And now they have one more foot soldier doing their bidding from the bench.
Stalin trained his secret police to do his bidding whenever he issued an order.
They can give orders and people rushed to do their bidding.
